Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.json

Class JsonNode

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.json.JsonNode
public class JsonNode
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a JSON node of the JSON tree. It can be used similar to DOM tree in the XML. Once was created, type of the node can't be changed, but it's value and it's children (if exists) can be changed anyway. Any node can have or not have name with some restrictions:

  • standalone item can have or can not have name
  • JsonNodeType.JsonArray children must not have names
  • JsonNodeType.JsonObject children must have unique names

Almost all the methods throw IllegalStateException exception when requested operation is not compatible with node type

Since:
0.0.4
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
JsonNodeType, JsonUtils

    • JsonNode

      public JsonNode​(JsonNodeType type, JsonNode... children) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      Constructor of the JsonNodeType.JsonArray or JsonNodeType.JsonObject JSON node

      Parameters:
      type - type of the node. Can be JsonNodeType.JsonArray or JsonNodeType.JsonObject only
      children - optional children of the node (can be changed later)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - invalid or null type, named children for JsonNodeType.JsonArray or unnamed ones for JsonNodeType.JsonObject
      java.lang.NullPointerException - child list is null or contains nulls inside

    • childrenCount

      public int childrenCount() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

      Get number of children in the node. This method can be used with JsonNodeType.JsonObject and JsonNodeType.JsonArray nodes only

      Returns:
      number of children
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - see class description

    • children

      public JsonNode[] children() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

      Get children of the node. This method can be used with JsonNodeType.JsonObject and JsonNodeType.JsonArray nodes only

      Returns:
      immutable list of children.Can be empty, but not null
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - see class description

    • addChild

      public JsonNode addChild​(JsonNode child) throws java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      Append new child into the node. This method can be used with JsonNodeType.JsonObject and JsonNodeType.JsonArray nodes only

      Parameters:
      child - node to append as child
      Returns:
      self (can be used in chained operations)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - see class description
      java.lang.NullPointerException - node no append is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - named node with JsonNodeType.JsonArray, or unnamed or non-unique named node with JsonNodeType.JsonObject

    • setChild

      public JsonNode setChild​(int childIndex, JsonNode child) throws java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      Replace child in the node. This method can be used with JsonNodeType.JsonObject and JsonNodeType.JsonArray nodes only

      Parameters:
      childIndex - child index to replace
      child - child node to set as new node
      Returns:
      self (can be used in chained operations)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - see class description
      java.lang.NullPointerException - node no append is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - child index out of range, named node with JsonNodeType.JsonArray, or unnamed or non-unique named node with JsonNodeType.JsonObject

    • removeChild

      public JsonNode removeChild​(int childIndex) throws java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      Remove child from the node. This method can be used with JsonNodeType.JsonObject and JsonNodeType.JsonArray nodes only

      Parameters:
      childIndex - child index to remove
      Returns:
      self (can be used in chained operations)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - see class description
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - child index out of range

      Get child from the node. This method can be used with JsonNodeType.JsonObject and JsonNodeType.JsonArray nodes only

      Parameters:
      childIndex - child index to get
      Returns:
      node selected. Can't be null
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - see class description
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - child index out of range
